timeline.message:
feat: Provide default COBOL code snippets #484

Signed-off-by: Azat Satklichov <azat.satklichov@broadcom.com>

refactor: adjust code snippets into ibm-specific snippets

Signed-off-by: Azat Satklichov <azat.satklichov@broadcom.com>

refactor: rename code-snippet prefix to shell

Signed-off-by: Azat Satklichov <azat.satklichov@broadcom.com>

refactor: insert more new code snippets

Signed-off-by: Azat Satklichov <azat.satklichov@broadcom.com>

timeline.bodyText: Do we really need them in different cases?
timeline.author: temanbrcom
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,1938 @@
+{
+	"add": {
+		"prefix": "add",
+		"body": [
+			"add ${1:a} to ${2:b} giving ${3:c}"
+		],
+		"description": "Add a to b giving c",
+		"scope": "cobol,acucobol,opencobol,gnucobol"
+	},
+	"ADD": {
+		"prefix": "ADD",
+		"body": [
+			"ADD ${1:a} TO ${2:b} GIVING ${3:c}"
+		],
+		"description": "Add a to b giving c",
+		"scope": "cobol,acucobol,opencobol,gnucobol"
+	},

replies.bodyText:
Do we really need them in different cases?

Yes, it is agreed by Scott. Just some dev. may prefer upper case, some lower cases.
replies.author: asatklichov

timeline.author: temanbrcom
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,1938 @@
+{
+	"add": {
+		"prefix": "add",
+		"body": [
+			"add ${1:a} to ${2:b} giving ${3:c}"
+		],
+		"description": "Add a to b giving c",
+		"scope": "cobol,acucobol,opencobol,gnucobol"
+	},
+	"ADD": {
+		"prefix": "ADD",
+		"body": [
+			"ADD ${1:a} TO ${2:b} GIVING ${3:c}"
+		],
+		"description": "Add a to b giving c",
+		"scope": "cobol,acucobol,opencobol,gnucobol"
+	},
+	"accept": {
+		"prefix": "accept",
+		"body": [
+			"accept ${1:variable}",
+			"$0"
+		],
+		"scope": "cobol,acucobol,opencobol,gnucobol"
+	},
+	"ACCEPT": {
+		"prefix": "ACCEPT",
+		"body": [
+			"ACCEPT ${1:variable}",
+			"$0"
+		],
+		"scope": "cobol,acucobol,opencobol,gnucobol"
+	},
+	"accept from": {
+		"prefix": "accept",
+		"body": [
+			"accept ${1:variable} ${2|from date,from day,from day-of-week,time|}",
+			"$0"
+		],
+		"description": "accept from date/day/week/time",
+		"scope": "cobol,acucobol,opencobol,gnucobol"
+	},
+	"ACCEPT FROM": {
+		"prefix": "ACCEPT",
+		"body": [
+			"ACCEPT ${1:variable} ${2|FROM DATE,FROM DAY,FROM DAY-OF-WEEK,TIME|}",
+			"$0"
+		],
+		"description": "ACCEPT FROM DATE/DAY/WEEK/TIME",
+		"scope": "cobol,acucobol,opencobol,gnucobol"
+	},
+	"class-id": {
+		"prefix": "class-id",
+		"body": [
+			"       class-id $1 ${3|public,private|}.",
+			"",
+			"       method-id new public.",
+			"       procedure division.",
+			"           $0",
+			"           exit method.",
+			"       end method.",
+			"",
+			"       end class."

replies.bodyText:
Is it still COBOL syntax?

Yes, it is reviewed.
replies.author: asatklichov
